definition: recurrent large circumscribed areas of subcutaneous edema; onset is sudden and it disappears within 24 hours; seen mainly in young women, often as an allergic reaction to food or drugs
opposite_reasoning: Dehydration is the strongest practical opposite for Edema. While 'NormalTissueHydration' would be conceptually ideal as the healthy baseline, Dehydration has several advantages: (1) Likely already exists in both WordNet and SUMO, ensuring availability; (2) Represents clear opposition on the tissue fluid spectrum (excess vs. deficit); (3) Both are well-defined pathological states making them comparable in semantic space; (4) Provides strong contrast for Fisher-LDA axis construction. Though both are disease states rather than disease-vs-health, this actually provides better dimensional separation since they occupy opposite extremes of the same underlying dimension (fluid balance).
